meanings.definition: Showing a tendency or inclination towards a particular point of view.
meanings.sent1: Her tendencious remarks clearly favored one side of the argument.
meanings.sent2: The article had a tendencious tone that leaned heavily towards a specific political party.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat seemed tendencious, always choosing to sit on the same person's lap.
meanings.sent4: The tendencious clouds in the sky seemed to be moving towards a storm.
meanings.sent5: The tendencious behavior of the clock always made it run a few minutes fast.

meanings.definition: Biased or inclined towards a particular opinion or perspective.
meanings.sent1: His tendencious review of the movie only highlighted the negative aspects.
meanings.sent2: The tendencious report failed to consider all sides of the issue.
meanings.sent3: The tendencious weather forecast predicted rain even on a sunny day.
meanings.sent4: The tendencious river flowed only towards the east, never changing its course.
meanings.sent5: The tendencious teacher always favored the same students in class discussions.
